title: OK so.... Pretty sure dyrus aint gunna improve at this point.
body:
Bench this nerd already.... how does someone play a video game for 5 years and still suck at it?

Pretty sure if you gave 90% of the league player base the amount of experience dyrus has they would be twice as good as him by now. And BTW i think solo-Q needs another tier above challenger. If this guy is NA challenger it clearly means nothing :0)

From what ive seen the koreans would probably be atleast 400 elo higher than NA challengers if they all moved to this server

Did you watch the games? Each game, Dyrus was camped the hell out of. And while I don't blame that entirely on Dyrus, unlike NA LCS, you can't leave your top laner on an island. Santorin is the real person to blame in this situation. He doesn't help Dyrus, and really barely helped Bjerg win his lane versus Faker.

So until you watch the game and understand what is happening, keep your salt about TSM losing to a minimum.

Please explain to me how exactly santorin could have helped in that situation.

No you blame Santorin for not being a presence in the game. He made what 2 ganks while Bengi was everywhere. It has nothing to do with when he did gank or for whom, it's what he did in the game. Which was nothing. He did nothing in the game versus Fnatic either.

I'm not saying that he is the reason Dyrus loses lane, but he doesn't do anything anywhere else on the map even while sacrificing top. Please tell me how he contributed more than Dyrus did, in any game.

I'm not a TSM fanboy, I'm not a fanboy of any team, but I can point out when one player gets sacrificed for his team, then the team fails to do anything with the sacrifice.

this^ in that first game, Reignover ganked top twice within 5 to 7 minutes, both successful. It's important to note that he was tower dived both times, one time he had half his health, the other time he had full, but Santorin did nothing. Nothing for top and nothing for the other lanes. IMO Santorin is the reason they lost, he provded no pressure whereas both junglers from the opposing teams were providing tons! There's nothing dyrus could have done any differently in these two games, it just came down to Santorin lacking presence as a jungler.

Do you watch ANY TSM games at all??? Dyrus is ALWAYS camped because every team KNOWS that is the weak link, and that is what you do to a weak link-you poke at it until it breaks.  Dyrus has been left to rot in his lane so many times, he has only one option-adapt.  And he hasn't....ever.  This is the game he and TSM play, and it stops working after a while.  Get in New blood, or adapt to not feed 2 kills to the best team in the world by 5 minutes.

Yes but usually the sacrifice of Dyrus is made up for by the rest of the team doing something. Bjerg rarely left his lane. Santorin did nothing in both of the games they lost (except gank an Alistar/Urgot lane and get pushed around by bengi).

I understand and even specified the general TSM strategy is to leave dyrus alone and let him fend for himself, but you cannot do that anymore. No team can. So why blame Dyrus when the team strategy of leaving him alone is shit? Why blame the lane that gets camped to meaninglessness when the jungler do nothing nothing to balance it out? 

The point of my original post was that TSM's sacrificing any member of the team is going to make them lose against any CN/KR team. How do they counter this? Counter-Gank Top? Help ward for your top? or hell gank top earlier than the other team!

Yes and not only that... if you actually WATCHED the match you would notice Dyrus had 100% kill participation for most of the game.  He got the few kills of the game as well.


IN this game TSM just fell apart.  Dyrus did his best to "pull agro" from the rest of the map (by kiting the jungler around thus dening farm/pressure) however the rest of the team just couldn't do anything.

Yea, even the commentators new that Dyrus was over-extending and pushing the wave to his own detriment.  He had the chance to farm from a safer position and didn't.  So, he died... again and again.  Santorin may as well have never existed in that game, same with Wild Turtle.  When the fights broke out I hardly noticed them, save for when their deaths popped up on screen.

> [{quoted}](name=Vixanys,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=Qw17AEA2,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-05-08T04:36:37.793+0000)

> 
> So until you watch the game and understand what is happening, keep your salt about TSM losing to a minimum.

Dyrus gave up 2 quick kills playing overly aggressive and not warding at all. I think he was over confident on Hecarim. But either way, he is always the subject to constant ganks because they know he is the weakest link. Games where he can farm up, he will be at best a wall to protect the backline. He's target banned in every match, and constantly camped. They specifically know he has a weak champion pool outside of Maokai, Sion, Lulu and Rumble. They need a new style of player in there, because Dyrus as a player isn't bad skill-wise, he just doesn't fit into the play style the rest of TSM do.

Dyrus is generally a solid, reliable top-laner, but I suspect the strategy of 'Camp Dyrus' has really hurt him.  He's so used to being camped, dove, and denied that I think he's actually losing his ability to play aggressively and often makes dumb mistakes when he gets the opportunity, like overextending.  He also doesn't seem to expect any assistance at all from the rest of the team, even when he really needs it, and he almost has to be on someone that doesn't need to farm to be good.

TSM needs to work together as a team to incorporate Dyrus back in as something other than the sacrificial top-lane.  He's got skills - I remember him carrying games from top lane last season - but with TSM's current playstyle he can't really do anything and I don't think anyone else in his position could either.
Finally a voice of reason! I'm sick of reading the "Dyrus is always camped" over and over and over. If he's always camped, do something about it and guess what, he'll stop being camped.

Dyrus is that guy I feel no one should complain about on TSM. Mainly because he gets thrown under the bus so hard. How can you really see how good he is if he never gets the chance to carry or really any support from his team?

Silver/Bronze elo 101: shove the lane, get ganked. Bengi didn't even 'camp', Marin just said, "Hey he's shoved way in come gank."... twice. After that, he did get camped and dove. As far as the overall team, every lane was losing except Bjerg. As a jungler, you can't help every lane. It was a loss from ~5-10 mins in due to bad laning from all of tsm. Nerves maybe, idk.

You can't compare the Korean scene to the NA scene.  Korean teams actually care about their sport and their livelihood and don't waste their time streaming solo queue.  They do actual practices and scrims and form real teams.  NA teams are just 5 people playing solo.  TSM is the epitome of that.
